main event: A bright light was observed descending toward Washington, D.C. on October 30, 1957.
interesting points: The object descended slowly at first, then rapidly went out of sight.,It appeared similar to a Roman candle with a trail.,The object was described as much like a bright star.,The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute.,The observer was located at the corner of 13th Street and Missouri Avenue.
sighted object: a bright light with a trail
witness description: The observer described the object as much like a bright star but with a trail that reminded him of fireworks.
